Key Match Events: The Dodgers won four World Series games with a .206 average, seven homers and 25 runs.
The Yankees won one World Series game with a .212 average, nine homers and 24 runs.
The Dodgers rallied from a five-run deficit to win the clincher, 7-6.
The Yankees played perhaps the worst fielding inning in World Series history in the fifth of Game 5, allowing five unearned runs to score with two outs.
Post-Match Reflections: Nestor Cortes commented on the importance of execution and how the Dodgers executed plays better than the Yankees.
The article reflects on the Yankees' recurring issues with fundamentals and execution, which were exposed by the Dodgers.
The Dodgers' scouting meetings highlighted the Yankees' weaknesses in fundamentals and baserunning.
